text: Hey Partners, I would love some advice on building a HubSpot API integration with a custom application for contact and deal management. We have started with a basic API call to create a deal based on a form submission on the application. The goal would be to have a 2 way sync between both systems, as a data element changes in one system, it would update the other. If a deal is updated in the system the application would be updated. We are currently sitting at about 150 custom properties in our application outside the standard contact & company information and outside of the transactional data - e.g. timestamps. I would love to talk with someone who's got some experience in building a full integration before we get started. We're planning development to start in September.
you'll probably want a 3 step process to synchronize the data. 1: sync existing data 2: add new that aren't already in one of the databases 3: delete old
it will probably be many more steps than that when it comes down to the APIs and how they work but I find it helps to simplify it a bit to get your head in the right space
<@U018122VBQU> we have build integration that helps syncing HubSpot data. Happy to answer your questions. Just DM me

:developers-developers-developers: We hosted a pretty epic API best practices event on July 14th. Just in case you missed it,  we've <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/event-recap-HubSpot-integration-and-api-best-practices-workshop|published our recap and event video on the developer blog>. :developers-developers-developers:
Hi There, I'm trying to figure the best way to reconstruct the profile url for a HubSpot contact after retrieving the contact id with the Contact Search API. Any suggestions are much appreciated.
Just on the off-chance I'm missing it in the docs, there's no way to do user management tasks in HubSpot via API correct? Say hitting an endpoint to remove a user from a portal?
Hi there. I created a HubSpot card and I would like to add two buttons (open an IFRAME) to the card same behavior as primaryAction. Does anyone know how to do it ?
